alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 224 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sugarite, or near Raton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Sugarite and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 449 and 457. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 350 and 357. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
